name: fluffiness
content:
fluffiness noun [U]
(SOFT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being soft and like wool or like fur: She loved the fluffiness of the towels in the hotel room. After three months, the cat had lost his kitten fluffiness.
the quality of being light and full of air: Beat the eggs and butter to fluffiness. Climate affects snow fluffiness.
More examplesFewer examplesYou will change the fluffiness of the cake if you try to use whole eggs instead of egg whites.He patted his hair to the right state of fluffiness.Whisk with a little milk for extra fluffiness.

fluffiness noun [U]
(NOT SERIOUS)
the quality of being pleasant but not serious or important: People liked his lightness and fluffiness but then complained they couldn't take him seriously. The film has a sharp edge to balance the fluffiness.
More examplesFewer examplesSurely the media's devotion to fluffiness has reached ridiculous heights when a national newspaper devotes three pages to the Princess's shoes.They think I'm just a silly woman with a head full of fluffiness.All people seem to want out of a movie is sickly feel-good fluffiness.
